alert.note: Alert for Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:29AM EST until January 12 at 11:54AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Rhode Island... Blackstone River At Northbridge affecting Worcester County. Blackstone River At Woonsocket affecting Providence and Worcester Counties. Wood River At Hope Valley affecting Washington County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Rhode Island...Connecticut... Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Kent and Providence Counties. Pawcatuck River At Westerly affecting Washington and New London Counties. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Blackstone River...including Northbridge, Woonsocket... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Pawtuxet River...including Scituate Reservoir, Cranston... Major flooding is forecast. For the Pawcatuck River...including Wood River Junction, Westerly... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Wood River...including Hope Valley...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Blackstone River at Woonsocket. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding will be comparable to the March floods of 2010. Flooding is likely in lower lying sections of Woonsocket and Cumberland. Deep floodwaters are expected in the lower level of the River Island Condominiums in Woonsocket. Several buisnesses along the river will have several feet of water into their parking areas, including the parking lot for the Cumberland school district buses. Vehicles should be moved from these areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 13.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 03/13/1936. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 830 PM EST.
